alert.note: Alert for Kalamazoo (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 05 at 9:56AM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Michigan, including the following county, Kalamazoo. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 954 AM EDT, reliable reports have been received of heavy rain in the advisory area. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain has already fallen in and around the Kalamazoo metro area. Rain will continue for several more hours, and additional rain of up to 1 inch is possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
